newsitem.title: USA: Calif Treas. to unveil anti-racism corporate plans.
newsitem.headline: Calif Treas. to unveil anti-racism corporate plans.

text.p: California state Treasurer Matt Fong on Monday will unveil a strategy to penalize companies for racial discrimination, according to a statement.
Fong's statement said the treasurer would hold a news conference Monday morning in Sacramento to "unveil a strategy to penalize corporate racial discrimination."

The advisory did not disclose the details of Fong's announcement, and a spokesman declined to elaborate. The spokesman would not confirm or deny whether the announcement would involve Texaco Inc's discrimination scandal.
Fong serves on the California Public Employees' Retirement System (CalPERS) board, the largest public pension fund in the U.S. with more than $100 billion in assets.

The Philadelphia pension board voted earlier this week to divest $5.5 million worth of Texaco stock, citing evidence of racial bias at the oil company. The divestiture came after revelations that tape recordings of discussions among Texaco executives were laced with racial slurs.
The tapes came to light in connection with a racial discrimination lawsuit filed against Texaco by six black employees.
